Name: Burj Khalifa
Remarks: Tallest freestanding structure in the world 2007–Present. Topped out in 2009.

Name: Tokyo Skytree
Remarks: Tallest structure in Japan and theOECD. Tallest tower in the world.

Name: Shanghai Tower
Remarks: Topped out in August 2013. Tallest structure in China.

Name: Goldin Finance 117
Remarks: Topped out in 2015, still uncompleted as of 2021.

Name: Lotte World Tower
Main use: Retail, residential apartments, hotel, offices, observation deck
Remarks: Topped out in 2016. Tallest building in theOECD.

Name: CN Tower
Remarks: Tallest freestanding structure in the world 1975–2007.

Name: One World Trade Center
Remarks: Tallest freestanding structure in the United States. Second tallest in thewestern hemisphere.

Name: Ostankino Tower
Remarks: Tallest freestanding structure in the world 1967–1975. Tallest structure in Europe.Renovated after a fire in 2000.

Name: Willis Tower(formerly Sears Tower)
Main use: Office, observation, UHF/VHF-transmission, later headquarters forUnited Airlines[2]
Remarks: Tallest building in the world 1974–1998 (by structural height).

Name: One World Trade Center (1973–2001)
Remarks: Destroyed on 11 September 2001. Tallest freestanding structure that no longer exists. Tallest building in the world 1972–1974.

Name: Taipei 101
Remarks: Tallest skyscraper in the world 2004–2010, first skyscraper to exceed 500 m/1,640ft in structural height.

Name: Oriental Pearl Tower
Remarks: Tallest structure in China (including Hong Kong), 1994–2007.

Name: Petronas Tower 1
Remarks: Tallest twin towers in the world. Tallest building in the world 1998–2004.

Name: Trump International Hotel and Tower
Remarks: Was the world's tallest concrete formwork structure upon completion. Originally planned to be the world's tallest building in 2001.

Name: Haeundae LCT The Sharp Landmark Tower
Inco Superstack
Remarks: Tallest chimney in the western hemisphere.

Name: Kennecott Smokestack
Remarks: Tallest free-standing structure west of theMississippi River.

Name: Zhoushan Island Overhead Powerline TieNorth tower
Remarks: Tallest set of electricity pylons in the world.

Name: Zhoushan Island Overhead Powerline TieSouth tower
Remarks: Tallest set of electricity pylons in the world.

Name: Bank of China Tower
Remarks: First skyscraper outside the United States to exceed 1,000ft (305 metres) in height.

Name: Bank of America Tower (New York City)
Stratosphere Tower
Remarks: Tallest Observation Tower in the United States.
